exercise.title: System Survey w/ Python
exercise.name: python_survey
exercise.shortdescription: Write a python script to survey a box.
exercise.description: Write a python script to survey a box.
exercise.tutorial:
Write python scripts to perform a light survey of the box (Windows and Unix) for you and output it to a text file. Retrieve the following information:

  • Uptime
  • OS Version
  • Users on box.
  • PS List - with PPID, CPU Time, Owner of each process, and Directory path being run out of.
  • Netstat - listing all listening and established connections mapped to the PIDs.
  • Scheduler/chron jobs - list all scheduled events to take place and the frequency of their occurrence.
  • Services - Get a list of the running services.

Keep in mind that running these commands will log somewhere. Try to find out where.

For Help: Email your code to adelphi-training-team@googlegroups.com for code review.

question.text: Why is determining the uptime of the box important?
question.answer: Helps establish the reliability of the box.
question.wrong: Helps establish how often the box is updated.
Helps establish how long a user has been using the box.
Helps establish how long the box has been up.
